data.title: Española Valley Doula Directory
data.meta_description: Jessica Frechette-Gutfreund LM, CPM is midwife and director for Breath of My Heart Birthplace. She has been involved with midwifery in New Mexico since her entrance into the profession through apprenticeship in 2007 at the Northern NM Midwifery Center in Taos, NM.
data.text:
Beata Tsosie-Peña

Beata is from Santa Clara Pueblo and El Rito and is certified as an Educator, Infant Massage Instructor (includes special needs and drug exposed considerations), Developmental Specialist, and in Indigenous Sustainable Design (permaculture). She worked for over a decade in the Environmental Health and Justice program for Tewa Women United. She is currently working as the Organizational Director for Breath of My Heart Birthplace. Her Jiya Vi Kagindi (Tewa for “Helper of the Mother”) birthworker training includes full spectrum and pregnancy loss, lactation counseling, and uses a reproductive justice frame that is inclusive of all families in various stages of their pregnancy journey. You can contact Beata Tsosie-Peña at jvkdoula@gmail.com, 505-927-1847

Sandy Martinez

Sandy Martinez is a Hispanic woman born in Albuquerque, NM and raised in Española. She is a proud young parent of 2, giving birth to her first daughter in the summer of 2016 and her second daughter at home in 2018. She runs a support group through Breath of My Heart Birthplace and is passionate about advocacy for young parents and reproductive rights in the Espanola Valley. Sandy is qualified to provide full-spectrum doula support, has experience in lactation education and is a facilitator of Circle of Security. You can contact her at san.doulala@gmail.com

Autumn Gomez

Autumn is a full-spectrum doula of Taos Pueblo and Comanche descent. Born and raised in Northern New Mexico, Autumn is dedicated to providing compassionate, non-judgemental care to expecting parents. She has been trained to provide prenatal, continuous labor, post-partum, and abortion care.

If you would like to meet Autumn, or if you are wondering if having a doula is right for you, please schedule a consultation at autumndawnfuture@gmail.com or 505-639-2359.

F.A. Marie (They/Them)

F.A. Marie is passionate about reproductive choices and support for all bodies. They are trained as a Doula with the Yiya Vi Kahgindi Doula programs through Tewa Women United, as a Community Health Worker through UNM Taos, and as a Lactation Consultant through the New Mexico Breastfeeding Task Force. They offer client centered full spectrum support in person and virtually in the areas of IUI, IVF pregnancy, labor, postpartum, lactation, miscarriage and abortion. They are born in New Mexico and raised in the Española, Pojoaque and Santa Fe areas and are grateful for the opportunity to serve their communities both locally and beyond. Contact them at 575-425-0524.
